N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 127.8 - Failure to appear; waiver

State Regulations

Except as provided in section
127.9
of this Part, in any case
where no adjournment is requested or, if requested, is not granted, the
respondent's failure to appear shall be deemed to be a waiver of hearing. Any
person who is deemed to have waived a hearing under these circumstances may
request a rehearing within a reasonable time, which shall, if such request is
granted, be held as soon as is practicable. However, any action taken at the
original hearing, or in effect at that time, may be continued pending such
rescheduled hearing. No rehearing will be scheduled as a substitute for an
appeal pursuant to section
127.12
of this Part. Upon a
respondent's failure to appear, the referee may receive the testimony of
available witnesses and enter evidence into the record. A respondent who has
waived a hearing by failing to appear may be suspended pending attendance at an
adjourned hearing or a final determination; provided, however, when a
respondent is suspended pending hearing pursuant to section
398-f
(1)(b)
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law, such
suspension shall be terminated upon the respondent's attendance at such
hearing. Notes
